abstract: Cuckoo Chaos and Gauntlet Hair exceed a critic's first-night expectations at the CMJ Music Marathon.
snippet: Cuckoo Chaos and Gauntlet Hair exceed a critic's first-night expectations at the CMJ Music Marathon.
lead_paragraph: The first day of the CMJ Music Marathon is for lowering expectations. I'm spoiled because most of the shows I hear during the year are by bands that have already gotten somewhere -- even if it's only to an opening-act slot with some indie-label pals -- and are playing clubs that expect people to listen. The beauty and aggravation of CMJ is that it's a plunge into the lower echelons, the ones triaged out of my usual schedule. This is the province of peculiar club layouts, blaringly murky sound systems and disheveled guys in yesterday's T-shirt poking at their keyboard and mixer, wishing they were Erasure circa 1989. I start to wonder if the next five days are going to be like that.

headline.main: A Couple of Good Bands Buoy CMJ's Opening Night
